turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: See ya later.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: What? Oh, come on. You're not gonna suck my cock?

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: To women. They're all whores. Let us not forget what Chenowsky said. "The greatest men are the most alone." And without suffering, Jeffery, you will never gain wisdom.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: I'm not suffering, you know. I don't give a shit.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Good. That's good.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Yeah. Yeah, no, you're right. It's no big deal, you know. Guy probably has his arm around her right now, holding her close, nudging her titty with his elbow, talking about the deep significance of his music, while she looks up at him with her big brown eyes. In a few minutes they'll be back at the Four Seasons. You ever, you ever stayed in one of those places?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Well, it ain't no pup tent in the garage, you know what I mean? Fuck. So they'll talk and talk. They'll probably talk all night. And, oh, they'll decide that they're gonna spend the night together, right? But, you know, they're gonna keep their underwear on and they're not gonna do anything. By six a.m. he's parking the pink Cadillac. Fuck. There's really only one answer.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Anarchy, my friend. Fuck 'em. You know what I mean?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Yeah, fuck 'em.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: No, no, say it like this. Fuck 'em!

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Fuck 'em! Fuck 'em all, man!

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Oh, no, no, no. This is no big deal, you know? I can come down and, and get you out.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: No, no. I'm not, I'm not talking about this. I did a bad thing, Jeff.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: What? What'd you do?

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: That chick, Erica?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Well, w-what happened?

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Well, I, you know, I took her to the van, you know. It was goin' all hot and heavy and she started hanging on me, you know? And she started crying, "Tim, Tim, what's the matter? I love you. Don't go!" And I was just looking at her stupid face and her stupid eyes, stupid mouth and I was filled with disgust, man. And I fuckin'... Oh, man, I really...

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: What'd you do?

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: I hit her.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: You hit her? Oh, wait, wait a minute. Why'd you hit her?

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Because I was fucked up, man. I just kept hittin' her till she didn't move anymore.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Wait a minute, wait a minute. She's unconscious?

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Go look, man. Go look. Go see for yourself, if you got the guts.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Oh fuck.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: They let you out?

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Yeah, of course they let me out. Chickenshits. I gotta pay some class C misdemeanor ticket. So did I call it or did I call it? She spent the night, didn't she? Hm? Oh, that sucks for you, pal. Oh, shit.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: You lied to me.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: You want to know what your problem is, Jeff? You want to believe so bad, you'll buy anything. It's true. Look at you. You're gullible and you're gutless.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: No, no. That's not the way it is at all. No, I stayed up all night trying to figure out how to protect my best friend. Wait, yeah, no, I was trying to come up with some lie so that you wouldn't have to go to jail for the rest of your life.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Wow. You did that for me?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Well, you know, all I can say is, you're a fucking fool.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Why? Because I give a shit?

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Oh, shit.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Because I care, I'm a fucking fool?

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Oh, Jeff, give me a break. You didn't even have the guts to go look in the van, did you?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Oh no, no. You know what? Fuck that. No, you lied to me. You lied to me because you're gutless. You're a gutless, drunken looser.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: I'm a loser. And I'm drunk. But I'm not gutless.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: You know, and what are you doing here in the first place, man? He's just gonna call the cops again.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Good, good. I, I hope he does.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: The sun hasn't even come up yet and you're drinking.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Hey, you saw that brown bitch point a gun at me last night, man. Did you think she was gonna use it?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: You don't know?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Come on. You don't think that after they called the cops on me, her and Mohammed had a nice laugh?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: No? Well, I disagree. I think they did. I think they probably went home last night and, you know, kicked off their sandals and had a nice laugh about the drunk on the corner, you know? Makes me sick.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: What are, what are you doing? Look, Tim, just go home. Alright. Go home and sleep it off.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Well, what am I supposed to sleep off? My life? You know, I'm supposed to go home and go to sleep and when I wake up, what'll I be, Jeff? A pilot? Maybe a Super Bowl quarterback or, no, maybe a fucking rock star. Right? I don't think so, man.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Just go home, alright?

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: This is my home.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Why, why did you start this in the first place, man? They never hurt you.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: They never hurt me? They hurt me every day with their attitude. You know, like they even have a right. Who the fuck do they think they are? Let me tell you something, I was born here. Alright? I'm an American. And I'm owed something. Look, they took it from me.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: They're just people. Alright? They got feelings, you know?

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: What about my feelings? What about my fucking feelings? These assholes, they come over here, they know all the answers, right? Well, they don't know shit.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Will you just put the gun down?

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Just put it down.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Jeff, stay there.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: He's got a gun. He's got a gun.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Well, then, there now, why don't you go inside and call the cops and I'll come in there and blow your fucking brains out.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Hey, w-why don't you see if he's hiring, you know? Get an application?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: That, that's Indian?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Tim, can we go? This is ridiculous.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Hey, Ma, look at me! Top of the world, Ma!

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Jeff! Come up here!

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Is that Bee-Bee?

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Come on!

turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: NAZEER
turns.text: Seven-twenty.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: I gave it to you.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Why we're just standing here.

turns.speaker: NAZEER
turns.text: Look, your trespassing.

turns.speaker: NAZEER
turns.text: You know, this, what you're doing with your life...

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: NAZEER
turns.text: You know, it's not you. You know? You seem like a smart guy.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Yeah, well, thank you for the advice, but you wouldn't understand what is going on with me.

turns.speaker: NAZEER
turns.text: Oh, it's very complicated, huh?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: NAZEER
turns.text: Complicated or not, life moves on. Hm?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: No, wait, wait! Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait! What is your name?

turns.speaker: NAZEER
turns.text: Look, why do you care, huh?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Because maybe if we know each other's names, things wouldn't get like this, My name's Jeff.

turns.speaker: NAZEER
turns.text: Okay. Nazeer, okay?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Nazeer what?

turns.speaker: NAZEER
turns.text: Nazeer Chaudry!

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Please?

turns.speaker: NAZEER
turns.text: Look, look, just get off my property.

turns.speaker: NAZEER
turns.text: This has nothing to do with me! She went up by herself. Yeah I tell them don't go on the roof! They can't go on the roof!  How is she?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: I don't know. I think she's breathing.

turns.speaker: NAZEER
turns.text: Okay. Okay, look my wife called the police. They're coming. It's not too late. They'll come, they'll take care of her. I'm going inside.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: God, I haven't seen you all day.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: You could've come over.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: I know, I know, I know.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Oh! Trim it!

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: I hate that.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Sorry. Let's go back to the van right now.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: No. I'm not going to the van, it's so gross. Come on. I'm doing my performance right now.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Okay, so maybe later.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Was that supposed to be me?

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: No, not, not everything. This. I am the man in your life.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Man?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Yeah, man, male, significant other, whatever the fuck I am.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: It's a piece.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Your sure as hell right about that.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: I'm not doing it anywhere, Jeff. It's just part of my application to the School of Visual Arts in New York.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: "The worst I can do is starve to death." Listen to you.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: I don't want to hear it anymore.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: No, no, no. Y-you know what? Y-your packing your bags, you're jumping into the unknown because some conceptual artist who teaches at a community college is having a mid-life crisis and he wants to sleep with some girl half his age, so he tells you you have talent.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Mister Brooks has had shows in New York, Jeff. He's been reviewed in Art Forum. I think he knows.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Oh, well, then you better listen to him.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Well, fuck! Might as well not do anything! Let's just stick out thumbs up our asses and twirl.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: What are you trying to communicate? Tell us.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: So you can give me more shit?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: No, no. It's an honest question. What are you trying to communicate?

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: I'm trying to communicate how I feel, Jeff. You know raise consciousness. Make people think for a change.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Yes, you asshole.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: About what?

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: About things that are important to me.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Sexual politics, racism, the environment, the military industrial...

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Of course I do!

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Name one.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: God, KAREN JOHNSON.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: One!

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Your completely missing the point.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Hey!

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: I'm talking about idealism.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: No, idealism is guilty, middle class bullshit.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: No, sweetie. Cynicism is bullshit.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: No, no, no. I'm not being cynical, I'm being honest.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: But do you stand for anything?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Yes, I stand for -

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: What? What do you stand for?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: I stand for honesty! I stand for some level of truth!

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Oh, yeah, right. Yeah, right. Fuck you.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Can I talk here? Let me talk.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: You know, all you know is what's good for you.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Can I talk?

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Typical male.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: I can't wait till Pony gets here, you know? Have a conversation with a human being?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Well, if you love him so much, why didn't you go see him play?

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Um, because you didn't want to go.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Like I'm going to pay twenty bucks to see Neil Moynihan in some band that I helped start.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Okay. Well, you know, he's always been a nice guy and I like him.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: This is ridiculous!

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Tim!

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: It was a racial incident.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: It was just something that got out of hand. Did anyone get hurt?

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: It got that close.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Okay, but nothing happened. Believe me, if I thought something really bad was going to happen, I would've done something.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Oh, yeah?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Okay, what would you have done.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: I would've stopped it.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: I don't know. I would've done something. This is kind of hypothetical, isn't it? This place is so stupid. I can't believe we're sitting here in this mosh-pit of consumerism. With all these people eating their chunks of dead flesh...

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Jeff. Jeff.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: ... like fucking robots. Look at those kids there.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Jeff. You know, I was talking to Mister Brooks yesterday. He has this friend in New York who wants to sublet his apartment for six-fifty a month. I could swing that. Six-fifty.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Sooze.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Did it ever occur to you that I might have some feelings about you moving to New York?

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: What feelings?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Us.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: And?

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Come with me.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: No, no, see, that's not what I'm saying. I could go to New York if I wanted to, but what's the point? So I can learn how to order a cappuccino? So I can get mugged by some crackhead? So I can see, see homeless people up close and personal?

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: So what do you wanna do?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: No one does nothing, Jeff.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Okay, well, then, I'm gonna break new ground.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: New ground?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Mm-hm.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Taking one community college course on the history of Nicaragua, while barely holding a job packing boxes?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Okay, look. My job is not who I am. I don't need that. Why? What's your goal? Status? Money? Getting your picture on the cover of some glossy magazine?

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: My goal is to make art.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: So, what, why can't you do that here? What's wrong with here? Why is somewhere else better?

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Why should I stay here, Jeff? So we can sit on the corner and watch the lights change, while you bitch about Burnfield?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Mm-mm.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: So I can spend the rest of my life guessing what it would be like to be a real artist?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: No, no.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: So you and I can fuck while your parents are out having dinner at the Sizzler? What are we doing, Jeff? You and me?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Yeah, uh, that would depend, but yeah. She should.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Mm.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Yeah, but that doesn't mean that your tree is not artistic if no one cuts it down.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Jeff likes to argue for the sake of arguing.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: No, I don't.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Yes, you do.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: No, I don't.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: You do.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: No, I don't.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: FUCK! Pony, if we wanted to hear you sing, we would've gone to your concert!

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Jeff!

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: So you sold ninety thousand units. So what? Does that mean you're a genius? You're a great artist? You're higher up the ladder? You got an extra gold star on your fuckin' forehead?

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Come on.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: No. No, no, no.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Come on. I'm not gonna go if you don't come.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: No, I just don't feel like it. That's all.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Why don't you just try? Please. For me. Come on.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Oh, hi. I thought you guys got lost.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Hey, where did you go? We were worried about you.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Gee, Jeff, I thought you were gonna go take a piss, not join some alcoholic nudist colony.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: No, no. I just got sick and tired of listening to that demo tape over and over again, you know? I mean, I felt like a fucking groupie, you know.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Mm. I enjoyed the ride. Sorry you didn't.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: But wait! Sooze, I don't wanna fight. I'm so sorry.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: No, I mean it. No, look, when, when I got out of the car I walked all the way here.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Mm-hm.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: And I fig- and I figured something out.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Oh, yeah?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: I, yeah.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Mm.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Wait, Sooze, I, I have to talk to you, 'cause I, there's something I figured out.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: God, you smell like whiskey.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: No, no, I have to talk to you.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Is that a threat?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Wait, wait, wait a minute, Sooze. What are you doing?

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: I'm leaving. Is that alright with you? Do I have your permission? Maybe you want to think about it.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: For a ride.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Wait, away?

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Yes, Jeff, away. Away, away, away.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: To his hotel?

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Shit, Jeff!

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: I've run out of words.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Wait. What, what are you saying?

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: I don't know. And I don't care that I don't know.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Well, what about us?

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: What about us? I'm moving away your staying here.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: No, maybe not though. That, that's what I'm trying to say.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Maybe not? You think that I'm with somebody else and now it's maybe not?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Oh, no, no, no.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: You're unbelievable.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Wait, no, I... Look, Sooze, I figured something out.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: You did, huh? Good for you.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Oh, fuck it, man!

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Do your covers and all that shit.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: 'Bye, Jeff.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Go.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Just go.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: You really suck, you know that?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Just go.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Hey, Pony.

turns.speaker: PONY
turns.text: Hey, man. Jeff. How're you doin?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Good, man.

turns.speaker: PONY
turns.text: Wow, man. The corner. I mean, nothing's changed.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Well, shit, man, you've only been gone for a year, man, Is that your limo?

turns.speaker: PONY
turns.text: Yeah, yeah. Yeah, the record company, they make me use it, you know. I mean, it's dumb, I know, it's just...

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: No, it's not...

turns.text: Hey, the driver knows Billy Idol. Wow, huh?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Yeah, hey I saw your album at Musicland up at the mall.

turns.speaker: PONY
turns.text: Oh yeah, yeah, we're starting to get good placement and shit like that, you know.

turns.speaker: JEFF
